cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 105 mi (165 km) south of Long Island, Bahamas and 55 mi (90 km) NNE of Cabo Lucrecia, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to parallel the Florida east coast before turning north-northeast near the Georgia–South Carolina coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the east-central Florida coast (around the Cape Canaveral–Daytona Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Flagler/Volusia county line to Fernandina Beach, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning North Palm Beach, FL to the Flagler/Volusia county line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. shoreline from central Florida through Georgia and South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely; a 22% chance exists for 50-kt (58 mph) winds and up to a 4–9% chance for hurricane-force gusts at Charleston.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center passes just offshore, surge of 3–6 ft above ground level in Charleston Harbor and adjacent coastal areas is possible, especially around high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, producing flash flooding in low-lying areas and along roadways leading to the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, minor coastal flooding, and reduced visibility in squalls will disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations.
